pullRequest.body:
This is a follow-up to [#12161](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12161).
It adds `HasProd` and `tsum` versions of the Euler Product statements for the Riemann zeta function and Dirichlet L-series (in the latter case, also replacing the explicit infinite sum by `L â†—Ï‡ s`).

See [this Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/L-series/near/438037266).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
For some reason, I tend to not think of `apply` in this situation...
Thanks for the speed-up!
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Congratulations :-) It's funny that we had special values of zeta at negative integers before we had resolved the issue of the definition of an infinite product :-)

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9125824521/job/25092825712)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9125824521/job/25092824508)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9125824521/job/25092824857)

```suggestion
  apply eulerProduct_completely_multiplicative_hasProd <| summable_riemannZetaSummand hs
```
(saves a few heartbeats)

```suggestion
/-- The Euler product for Dirichlet L-series, valid for `s.re > 1`.
This version is stated in the form of convergence of finite partial products. -/
```
(for consistency)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/EulerProduct/DirichletLSeries): use infinite product and L-series
